title: The Great Depression
key_facts: The worst economic downturn in the history of the industrialized world.
Began after the stock market crash of October 1929 (Black Tuesday).
Caused massive unemployment, deflation, and poverty globally.
Ended with the economic mobilization for World War II.
causes: Stock market crash of 1929 due to speculation and buying on margin.
Bank failures and the collapse of the money supply.
Reduction in purchasing power and consumer demand.
outcome: Expansion of government role in the economy (New Deal in the US).
Rise of extremist political movements (Fascism in Europe).

figures.name: Herbert Hoover
figures.significance: Criticized for his initial laissez-faire response to the crisis.

figures.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
figures.significance: Implemented the 'New Deal' programs to provide relief, recovery, and reform.

figures.name: John Maynard Keynes
figures.significance: Advocated for government spending to stimulate the economy.

impacts: Global unemployment rates reached as high as 25-33%.
Destabilization of the Weimar Republic in Germany, aiding Hitler's rise.
Creation of social safety nets (Social Security in the US).
sources: Bernanke, B. (2000). Essays on the Great Depression.
Library of Congress. (n.d.). Great Depression and World War II, 1929-1945.
